p: The microwave measurements were also performed on a series of water-in-tar oil emulsion samples which were prepared for various emulsifying time. As is shown in Fig. 9, the measured dielectric constant increases with the emulsifying time, and correspondingly the dispersity factor rises considerably from 0.42 at 1 min to 0.70 at 20 min. The variation of measured dielectric constant with the emulsifying time demonstrated that the microwave analysis is capable of characterizing heavy oil emulsions.
